verses.verse: I haue loued: because God hath hearde my voyce [and] my prayers.
Because he hath enclined his eare vnto me: therfore I wyll call vpon hym as long as I lyue.
The snares of death compassed me rounde about: and the paynes of hell toke holde on me. (116:4) I founde anguishe and heauinesse,
but I called vpon the name of God: [saying] O God, I beseche thee deliuer my soule
Gratious is God and ryghteous: our Lorde is mercifull.
God gardeth the simple: I was brought to the extremitie, and he preserued me.
Returne O my soule vnto thy rest: for God hath rewarded thee.
For [thou O Lorde] hast deliuered my soule from death: myne eyes from teares, and my feete from fallyng.
I wyll walke before the face of God: in the lande of the lyuyng.
I beleued, therfore I wyll speake: I was sore afflicted,
(116:10) insomuch that I said in my rashnesse euery man is a lyer.
(116:11) What rewarde shal I geue vnto God: for all the benefites that he hath done vnto me?
(116:12) I wyll take the cuppe of saluation: and I wyll call vpon the name of God.
(116:13) I wyll pay my vowes nowe vnto God: in the presence of all his people.
(116:14) The death of his saintes: is precious in the eyes of God.
(116:15) It is euen so O God, for I am thy seruaunt and the sonne of thy handemayde: thou hast loosed my bondes in sunder.
(116:16) I wyll offer vnto thee the sacrifice of thankesgeuyng: and I wyll call vpon the name of God.
(116:17) I wyll pay my vowes vnto God in the sight of all his people:
(116:17) in the courtes of Gods house, euen in the myddest of thee O Hierusalem. Prayse ye the Lorde.
